The whole premise of fractional reserve banking is fraudulent.
 
 You deposit your money with the bank with the promise that you can withdraw it whenever you want. The bank then lends it out to a mortgagee who is contracted to pay it back over 30 years, with no obligation to return it any sooner.
 
 Essentially the bank has promised two people it can have full access to the same money at the same time. Hence in the 1920s, when people demand their money back, there isn't enough to go around.
 
 The solution? Obviously not the free market solution of punishing banks engaged in this duplicity for fraud, or at least allowing them to go under and hoping the rest learn something about what happens when you take this system too far, but instead the government underwrites the loans, putting the taxpayer on the hook for their slimy endeavours encouraging the banks to take on ever more leveraged positions.
